translation.en: -[player 1] Keep the pack together! -[players yelling]
[player 1] Come on, Arthur!
[player 2] Drive it forwards.
[player 3] Well played, Arthur.
-[boy 1] Here he comes! -[boy 2] Are you sure it's him?
[reporter] Mr. Kinnaird, will the Old Etonians take the FA Cup this year?
translation.de: Mr. Kinnaird, holen die Old Etonians dieses Jahr den Titel?

translation.en: [boy 1] Can we have an autograph?
What of your quarter-final opponents, Darwen FC?
translation.de: Was sagen Sie zu Ihrem Viertelfinalgegner, dem FC Darwen?

translation.en: What do you think? Can they stop me winning another Cup?
translation.de: Was meint ihr? Haben sie eine Chance?

translation.en: -Oh, no, no, no! Not at all, sir! -[boy 1] Never!
You can quote them on that.
Ah, it's a wonder your head still fits through the door.
translation.de: Ein Wunder, dass dein Kopf noch durch die Tür passt.

translation.en: [man] Fergus Suter, you and I are gonna make history.
translation.de: Fergus Suter, wir beide werden Geschichte schreiben.

translation.en: [station attendant] Darwen. This is Darwen.
-[train whistle blows] -Come on. Let's go.
[man] I've seen how you play in Scotland.
translation.de: Ich sah euch in Schottland spielen.

translation.en: Your passing game is the future of football.
translation.de: Euer Passspiel ist die Zukunft des Fußballs.

translation.en: [man] Let's talk in my office.
So...
-How you both feeling? -Ready to get started.
So long as you keep your end of the bargain.
translation.de: Wenn Sie sich an die Abmachung halten.

translation.en: Food and board's all arranged, as agreed.
They're not gonna know what's hit 'em.
translation.de: Die werden ihr blaues Wunder erleben.

translation.en: Who are the new lads, then?
No idea.
[man 1] Not from round here, that's for sure.
They're not mill workers either.
[man 2] Why has Walsh gone and brought them here?
translation.de: Was will Walsh dann von ihnen?

translation.en: [man 3] Got our new jerseys, lads.
translation.de: Hier sind die neuen Trikots, Jungs.

translation.en: Finished 'em up last night.
[man 3] And youse, captain.
-There you go. -[man 4] Ready for the big game Saturday?
And one for each of the new lads.
That's all there was, Mr. Walsh. I've only done 11.
translation.de: Das waren alle, Mr. Walsh. Ich hatte nur elf.

translation.en: Jones, Harris, you don't mind, do you?
translation.de: Jones, Harris? Es macht euch doch nichts aus, oder?

translation.en: I'd like to give Mr. Suter and Mr. Love a chance.
translation.de: Ich will Mr. Suter und Mr. Love spielen sehen.

translation.en: Fergus Suter...
and Jimmy Love?
Not the Fergus Suter and Jimmy Love who play for Partick?
translation.de: Doch nicht die, die für Partick spielen?

translation.en: They don't play for Partick anymore. They're Darwen players now.
translation.de: Nicht mehr. Jetzt spielen sie für Darwin.

translation.en: Mr. Walsh,
with respect, sir, Jones and Harris helped us get to the quarter-finals.
translation.de: Bei allem Respekt, die zwei brachten uns ins Viertelfinale.

translation.en: And these two are going to help us win the damn thing. Now, this is my mill.
translation.de: Und die beiden holen den Pokal. Das ist meine Fabrik.

translation.en: My team.
[Walsh] Now, give 'em the jerseys.
[Walsh] Good lads.
I've put you in here.
This is nice.
[woman] Mr. Walsh was most particular. Which of you is Mr. Suter?
translation.de: Mr. Walsh hatte klare Vorstellungen. Wer von Ihnen ist Mr. Suter?

translation.en: That's me.
That means you must be Mr. Love.
translation.de: Dann müssen Sie Mr. Love sein.

translation.en: Guilty as charged.
Does Mr. Platt work for Mr. Walsh?
translation.de: Arbeitet Mr. Platt für Mr. Walsh?

translation.en: Uh, he used to. I'm a widow.
Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.
-Jimmy, for the love of God, no. -What?
[Fergus] Keep your mind on the game.
Did you know there were 43 teams in the Cup this year?
translation.de: In diesem Jahr haben 43 Mannschaften teilgenommen.

translation.en: And Arthur's is one of the last eight left in.
translation.de: Und Arthurs zählt zu den letzten acht.

translation.en: Isn't that splendid?
We're playing a mill team in the quarter-finals this Saturday, Papa.
translation.de: Wir spielen im Viertelfinale gegen eine Fabrikmannschaft.

translation.en: Really?
The quarter-finals?
Do the millhands often get that far?
translation.de: Kommen die Arbeiter oft so weit?

translation.en: [Arthur] No, not usually.
[Lord Kinnaird] Will you go on with this once your child arrives?
translation.de: Wirst du weiterspielen, wenn du Vater bist?

translation.en: I hadn't given it much thought.
Did you play much sport, Papa?
translation.de: Hast du viel Sport getrieben, Papa?

translation.en: I shot, of course.
I never hunted.
-I'm not against it-- -But you are against football?
translation.de: -Ich habe nichts dagegen, aber... -Aber gegen Fußball?

translation.en: No, no, no, no, no.
I think it a healthy way for little boys to get fit.
translation.de: Für Knaben ist das Spiel durchaus geeignet.

translation.en: [station attendant] All aboard!
All passengers!
Train's about to depart!
All aboard, please!
[Walsh] Only gentlemen have lifted the Cup.
Men from fine schools,
with fine clothes, fine lives.
translation.de: in feinem Zwirn und aus feinem Hause.

translation.en: Imagine what it would mean to see men like us lift it.
translation.de: Was würde es wohl bedeuten, wenn wir ihn gewännen?

translation.en: That's the dream.
[Walsh] Well, I want to wake up and find it's more than a dream.
translation.de: Ich will, dass es mehr ist als ein Traum.

translation.en: To find out it's happened.
See, that's the reason I brought you to Darwen, Fergus.
translation.de: Darum habe ich dich nach Darwen geholt, Fergus.

translation.en: [Walsh] Wait here, lads.
[Darwen player] Stop, lads. Hold up.
What do you make of this, lads?
You'd think the Queen lived here.
Boys.
-[Darwen player] Look at these lads! -Gentlemen.
[Arthur] Welcome.
I'm, uh... I'm captain of the Old Etonians.
translation.de: Ich bin Kapitän der Old Etonians.

translation.en: -You're Arthur Kinnaird? -That's right.
I saw you play at Hampden a few years back against Queen's Park.
translation.de: Ich sah Sie mal in Hampden gegen Queen's Park spielen.

translation.en: [stammers] You were good.
Well, that's high praise indeed.
Of course, the game's changed since your heyday.
translation.de: Aber das Spiel hat sich verändert.

translation.en: I mean, it has in Scotland, at least.
Must be hard moving with the times.
Well, now we've established that my best days are in the past,
translation.de: Nun, wenn meine beste Zeit hinter mir liegt,

translation.en: perhaps we should get moving.
-I never meant-- -What's your name?
translation.de: -sollten wir uns beeilen. -Das war nicht... Wie heißen Sie?

translation.en: The Suter who plays for Hibernian?
translation.de: Der Suter, der für Hibernian spielt?

translation.en: Well, I used to, at any rate.
Now I play for Darwen.
It's hardly a... hardly a local team for you.
translation.de: Nicht gerade... ein Heimatverein für Sie.

translation.en: Jimmy and I wanted a change of scene.
translation.de: Jimmy und ich wollten uns verändern.

translation.en: -He made the trip down, too. -Did he indeed?
Uh, everyone, these boys will show you to your changing rooms.
translation.de: Die Jungs hier zeigen Ihnen die Umkleideräume.

translation.en: [Darwen player] Hurry up, lads. Suit up and boot up.
I've been through our Football Association records,
and neither Fergus Suter nor Jimmy Love played for them in the previous rounds.
translation.de: Weder Fergus Suter noch Jimmy Love haben zuvor für sie gespielt.

translation.en: There's nothing in the rules that say they can't switch team members.
True, but why would two successful Scottish players
translation.de: Ja, aber warum sollten zwei erfolgreiche schottische Spieler

translation.en: leave Glasgow to join a tinpot mill team in Darwen?
translation.de: Glasgow verlassen und bei einem Dorfteam anheuern?

translation.en: Clearly, they're being paid.
To play football? But that's against the rules.
translation.de: Um Fußball zu spielen? Das ist gegen die Regeln.

translation.en: Surely, no one would risk suspension from the Cup?
translation.de: Damit würden sie einen Ausschluss riskieren.

translation.en: It would explain why two players would travel from Scotland to join a team they have no connection with.
translation.de: Es erklärt, warum zwei Schotten für ein völlig fremdes Team spielen.

translation.en: -Now, how do we prove it? -[Arthur] We don't need to.
We'll beat them today,
and they'll be knocked out the competition.
translation.de: und werfen sie aus dem Wettbewerb.

translation.en: -Are we right, lads? -[players] Aye.
[Walsh] Now, remember, they're a rough team.
They'll play as a pack and try to run through you.
translation.de: Sie werden versuchen, euch zu überrollen.

translation.en: -[player 1] Let's go then, boys. -[player 2] Come on. Stick together.
When we get out, I lead from the front.
translation.de: Ich gehe nach dem Anpfiff voran.

translation.en: -Come on. -[Jimmy] Fergie!
You coming?
[woman] What's all this to-do about?
Playing in the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. -Really? -Yeah.
Just waiting on news from the match.
translation.de: Ja. Wir warten auf Neuigkeiten vom Spiel.

translation.en: Well, I've made it, Mr. Suter,
even if my glory days are behind me.
translation.de: Auch wenn meine Glanzzeit hinter mir liegt.

translation.en: Right. Let's knock these posh bastards off the perch.
translation.de: Gut. Hauen wir diese noblen Mistkerle in die Pfanne.

translation.en: Right. Go on, lads. Let's go.
Is that it?
I suppose he's the captain, Fergus.
translation.de: Er ist wohl der Kapitän, Fergus.

translation.en: Stay tight.
Yep.
[Etonian player] Come on, boys. Send them back.
[Fergus] Play the ball.
[Darwen player] Come on! In tight!
-[Arthur] Take him! -[Fergus grunts]
[Darwen player] Come on now!
Game doesn't seem to have changed so very much, Mr. Suter.
translation.de: So viel hat sich wohl doch nicht verändert, Mr. Suter.

translation.en: [Darwen player] Come on. Come on, boys.
[man] The Old Etonians have scored again!
translation.de: Noch ein Tor für die Old Etonians!

translation.en: -[Darwen player] There we go! -Yes!
-We got one back! -[crowd cheers]
-It's three-one! -Yes!
-[whistle blows] -[referee] Half-time!
[referee] Half-time, gentlemen.
That Kinnaird is a bloody hard man to get around.
We need to fight fire with fire.
They shove you, you shove 'em back. They hit you, you hit 'em back.
-You can't win playing at their own game. -So, what do you suggest we do instead?
translation.de: -Das wird nicht funktionieren. -Was schlägst du dann vor?

translation.en: [Etonian] At this rate, I'm gonna be coming out.
translation.de: Wenn das so weitergeht, schieße sogar ich ein Tor.

translation.en: I want five more goals this half,
so we have something to celebrate at dinner. [all] Yes!
What makes you such an expert? I'm telling you how we play in Scotland, that's all.
translation.de: -Was macht dich zum Experten? -So spielt man in Schottland.

translation.en: Would you listen to him?
But Marshall's the captain.
Well, Suter's the captain now.
Lads, football is not complicated.
We don't always have to run the ball forward.
translation.de: Man muss nicht nach vorne rennen.

translation.en: I'll stay behind, and I'll play it back.
translation.de: Ich bleibe hinten und spiele euch den Ball zu.

translation.en: Jimmy, you know what you're doing, right?
Tommy, this game is about space.
translation.de: Bei diesem Spiel geht es um Raum, Tommy.

translation.en: I want you to go out wide on the left.
translation.de: Geh auf den linken Flügel. Du bist der Schnellste hier.

translation.en: You're the fastest man on the pitch. You're not getting a chance to show it.
translation.de: Geh auf den linken Flügel. Du bist der Schnellste hier. Aber du kannst es nicht zeigen. Lass den Ball die Arbeit machen.

translation.en: [Fergus] Let the ball do the work.
translation.de: Aber du kannst es nicht zeigen. Lass den Ball die Arbeit machen.

translation.en: We pass, we move, we pass again.
translation.de: Wir passen, laufen und passen wieder.

translation.en: Space.
But that's not how we play.
Wider. Right out onto the touchline.
translation.de: Weiter raus. Bis an die Seitenlinie.

translation.en: Spread out.
-They've moved their formation. -Isn't that better?
translation.de: Sie ändern ihre Formation. Umso besser. Dann laufen wir einfach durch.

translation.en: We'll run right through them.
translation.de: Umso besser. Dann laufen wir einfach durch.

translation.en: -Come on, boys! I want the same again. -[whistle blows]
translation.de: Los, Jungs! Noch mal so wie vorhin!

translation.en: -[Arthur] Same again! -Here we go, Darwen.
[Fergus] Yes!
Yes!
[player] Get it over to him! Yeah!
It's five-four!
The ball's gone before you can put a tackle in.
translation.de: Der Ball ist viel zu schnell weg.

translation.en: Just do whatever it takes.
translation.de: Tut einfach, was nötig ist. Kommt schon!

translation.en: Come on! Come on!
translation.de: Tut einfach, was nötig ist. Kommt schon! Na los!

translation.en: [woman] It's five-five!
[referee] It's full-time, gentlemen.
-[thunder rumbling] -[referee] Full-time, thank you.
We'll take a few minutes to get fresh air into our lungs and then extra time.
translation.de: Wir verschnaufen ein paar Minuten, dann geht's in die Verlängerung.

translation.en: Look, no extra time was agreed before the game.
Since when was that a rule?
It's not in Scotland. It is here.
Come on, boys.
[Etonian player] I'm glad that's finished. That was more tiring than I expected.
translation.de: Gut, dass es vorbei ist. Das war mühsamer als gedacht.

translation.en: He said no to extra time.
What's all this about? Why are we not playing extra time?
translation.de: Was soll das? Warum spielen wir keine Verlängerung?

translation.en: [Fergus] Because he knows they're beaten.
It'll be replayed next Saturday.
These men have been up since before dawn and traveled for hours.
You expect them to do it all again?
translation.de: Sollen sie das etwa noch mal tun?

translation.en: We're here now. Let's finish it now.
translation.de: Wir sind hier. Bringen wir es zu Ende.

translation.en: Look, we can refer this to the president of the Football Association, if you prefer.
translation.de: Wir können den Verbandspräsidenten fragen, wenn Sie wollen.

translation.en: -Well, how long will that take? -Not too long.
He's the president of the FA? He's your bloody goalkeeper.
translation.de: Er ist der Präsident? Ihr verdammter Torwart?

translation.en: We're all on the board of the Football Association. Do you have a problem with that?
translation.de: Wir sind alle im Vorstand. Haben Sie ein Problem damit?

translation.en: Don't you?
I'm afraid extra time wasn't agreed, gentlemen.
Those are the rules.
And rules are made to be adhered to. [Fergus] We had you beaten today.
translation.de: -Und an Regeln hält man sich. -Wir hätten gewonnen.

translation.en: You know we did.
If you are right,
then you'll beat us again...
next Saturday.
No, I just worry one day Arthur will come home with a broken leg.
translation.de: Eines Tages kommt Arthur mit einem gebrochenem Bein nach Hause.

translation.en: Well, if he does, you can be sure it won't be his own.
translation.de: Aber es wird nicht sein Bein sein.

translation.en: -[Alma laughs] -What am I missing up there?
Oh, Monkey's telling me about the game.
translation.de: Monkey erzählt mir nur vom Spiel.

translation.en: Ah, Arthur's returning the favor at this end of the table.
Have you told her how it ended?
[sighs] There's nothing to tell.
Well, now I'm intrigued.
[chuckles] Uh, it's not really my story.
How strange. Usually, I can't stop you talking about football.
translation.de: Ach ja? Sonst redest du ständig über Fußball.

translation.en: Or cricket.
Or rugby, for that matter.
When it was a draw, Arthur wouldn't allow them extra time to settle it.
So they must come back next week.
All the way from Lancashire?
In all the years we've been married, I believe this is the first time you've ever asked me a single question about football.
translation.de: Das ist das erste Mal, dass du dich für Fußball interessierst.

translation.en: But is it true, Arthur?
We had to do what was right.
translation.de: Ich tat nur, was richtig war.

translation.en: It seems rather unkind.
-Can I second that? -[Marindin] We must follow the rules.
-Or why do we have them? -Absolutely.
And if you'd agreed extra time, Darwen would've beaten you.
translation.de: Hätte Darwen euch in der Verlängerung geschlagen?

translation.en: [chuckles] Don't be absurd.
Sorry, old boy, but I must agree.
Another ten minutes and you would've been out of the Cup on your ear.
translation.de: Zehn Minuten länger, und ihr hättet verloren.

translation.en: Are you suggesting I acted in an underhand manner?
translation.de: Soll das heißen, dass ich vorsätzlich gehandelt habe?

translation.en: Well, I think "underhand" is a bit strong. Shall we say, uh, the rules were very convenient.
translation.de: "Vorsätzlich" wäre übertrieben. Sagen wir, die Regeln kamen euch zupass.

translation.en: Do you really think we would've been beaten by a gaggle of--
translation.de: Glaubst du wirklich, dass wir gegen diese Bande von...

translation.en: Of what? Mill workers?
No. Professionals.
Darwen team are fielding professional players.
Paying two members of their team to play.
But what's wrong with that?
This is a game for amateurs and gentlemen.
translation.de: Das Spiel ist für Amateure und Gentlemen.

translation.en: It's our game. [laughs] Your game?
-We invented it. -[Alma] Who's "we"?
The Old Etonians?
[Arthur] Yes! As a matter of fact.
Eton, Charterhouse, Harrow. Lots of schools played a part,
translation.de: Eton, Charterhouse, Harrow... sie alle haben mitgewirkt.

translation.en: but the point is we took a raggle-taggle pastime...
with different rules wherever it was played, and we turned it into a proper game.
translation.de: ...mit völlig willkürlichen Regeln ein richtiges Spiel gemacht.

translation.en: For gentlemen.
Heavens. Do gentlemen shout?
translation.de: Ach ja? Seit wann schreien Gentlemen?

translation.en: Ladies... I'm catching your eye.
translation.de: Meine Damen... Die Stimmung scheint mir etwas angespannt.

translation.en: Shall we leave the men to their port?
Well, shall we talk about something a little less contentious?
translation.de: Lasst uns über ein weniger strittiges Thema reden.

translation.en: What? Like the Russian-Turkish War?
I feel like a fraud. We're celebrating like we won.
translation.de: Das ist nicht richtig. Wir feiern, als hätten wir gewonnen.

translation.en: We didn't win, did we?
We came nearer to winning than we ever have done before. And we may yet do it Saturday.
translation.de: Wir waren dem Sieg näher als je zuvor. Und wir können immer noch gewinnen.

translation.en: Look around.
You've given these people something to believe in.
translation.de: Dank dir glauben diese Leute an etwas.

translation.en: The game feeds the soul
when they have nothing else that does it in their life.
translation.de: Anders als der Rest ihres Leben.

translation.en: I'm gonna head back.
-Come on, it's just getting started. -Jimmy, here.
translation.de: -Der Abend ist doch noch jung. -Hier, Jimmy.

translation.en: Don't drink too much.
Fergie, come on, pal. Look, what's one more beer?
translation.de: Komm schon, Fergie. Nur noch ein Bier.

translation.en: Come on.
Well, I suppose I am allowed an opinion.
translation.de: Darf ich keine eigene Meinung haben?

translation.en: Not on things you don't understand.
translation.de: Nicht, wenn du nichts davon verstehst.

translation.en: I think I understand perfectly.
You're afraid of them, aren't you?
Afraid?
You're afraid new teams like Darwen will take over your game.
translation.de: Angst, dass Teams wie Darwen euer Spiel übernehmen.

translation.en: You and Alfred and all the others.
translation.de: Du, Alfred und all die anderen.

translation.en: You're scared you'll lose control of it.
translation.de: Ihr habt Angst, die Kontrolle zu verlieren.

translation.en: That's ridiculous.
Is it?
Arthur, you're a decent man, but this game brings out the worst in you.
translation.de: Dieses Spiel hat keinen guten Einfluss auf dich.

translation.en: Makes you childish and defensive and petulant.
translation.de: Du bist kindisch, defensiv und gereizt.

translation.en: Well, I'm sorry if I disappoint you.
translation.de: Tut mir leid, wenn ich dich enttäusche.

translation.en: What?
I want us to be good parents...
translation.de: Ich will, dass wir gute Eltern sind.

translation.en: and to set a good example for our child.
translation.de: Und gute Vorbilder für unser Kind.

translation.en: We will be.
Of course we will be. Why wouldn't we be?
I'm Fergus... Suter.
Oh, I know who you are.
People won't stop shouting your name.
I'm Martha Almond.
You should've sung in the pub tonight.
translation.de: Du hättest im Pub singen sollen.

translation.en: I should get going.
I could...
I could walk you home, if you like.
See, it's like this.
I have a little girl. She's two years old. She has no dad.
translation.de: Ich habe eine Tochter. Sie ist zwei. Sie hat keinen Vater.

translation.en: He's gone, but... I was never married to him in the first place.
translation.de: Er ist weg, aber... wir waren sowieso nicht verheiratet.

translation.en: Do you still want to walk me home?
translation.de: Willst du mich immer noch begleiten?

translation.en: Sure.
Why not?
We got off on the wrong foot. Let me buy you another.
translation.de: Wir hatten einen schlechten Start. Ich gebe dir eins aus.

translation.en: I shouldn't.
But go on, then.
I'm buying, though. No arguments.
So what did Walsh offer to get you all the way down from Glasgow?
translation.de: Also, was hat Walsh euch geboten, um euch hier runter zu locken?

translation.en: [man] Oh, my head!
Feels good to have a man in the house again.
translation.de: Schön, wieder einen Mann im Haus zu haben.

translation.en: I hope you don't mind me saying, but...
translation.de: Ich will nicht aufdringlich sein, aber...

translation.en: you've got a lovely smile.
-Sorry, I don't mean to embarrass you. -No, you didn't.
translation.de: -Ich wollte Sie nicht verlegen machen. -Nein, schon gut.

translation.en: What's coming next, I wonder?
How about this?
We best get going.
Aye, we should.
-Thanks for that. -Ah, pleasure.
Oh, won't you have some breakfast? Oh, just a piece of bread.
translation.de: -Möchten Sie nicht frühstücken? -Ein Stück Brot genügt.

translation.en: Gentlemen,
the situation is no longer tenable.
translation.de: Die Situation ist nicht mehr haltbar.

translation.en: Our mills are struggling to turn a profit,
and the banks are starting to call in their loans.
translation.de: und die Banken wollen ihre Kredite zurück.

translation.en: It is regrettable that the only course of action
translation.de: Es ist bedauerlich, aber der einzige Weg,

translation.en: I can see to protect our business is a wage cut.
translation.de: unser Geschäft zu schützen, sind Lohnkürzungen.

translation.en: As chairman of the guild, I must insist that we present a united front on this matter.
translation.de: Als Vorsitzender wünsche ich, dass wir dabei geschlossen auftreten.

translation.en: To do otherwise would only invite trouble.
translation.de: Alles andere würde nur Ärger bedeuten.

translation.en: I propose a five-percent wage cut for every worker.
translation.de: Ich schlage fünf Prozent weniger Lohn für alle Arbeiter vor.

translation.en: -All those in favor. -[all] Aye!
All those against?
Nay.
Most of my workers have families.
They can barely get by as it is.
translation.de: Sie tun sich jetzt schon schwer.

translation.en: James, you know I don't like it,
translation.de: Mir gefällt es auch nicht, James.

translation.en: but the alternative is that the mills go out of business.
translation.de: Aber andernfalls gehen die Fabriken pleite.

translation.en: [man] How will they get by then?
translation.de: Wie schwer wird es dann für sie?

translation.en: How many workers do you employ at your mill, Mr. Walsh?
translation.de: Wie viele Arbeiter beschäftigen Sie, Mr. Walsh?

translation.en: A couple of hundred?
A hundred and seventy-seven.
Across my mills, I have 3,000.
Two thousand.
Two-and-a-half.
[chairman] The motion is passed.
Every member of the Cotton Masters' Guild
will impose the same cut in wages.
Do you ever worry...
about whether you'd make a good father?
translation.de: ...ob du ein guter Vater sein würdest?

translation.en: Not really.
I suppose I assumed...
that it would be just as it had been for my father.
translation.de: ...dass es so sein würde wie für meinen Vater.

translation.en: And for his father before him.
translation.de: Und für seinen Vater vor ihm.

translation.en: I don't remember seeing much of you when I was young.
translation.de: Ich habe dich damals nicht oft gesehen.

translation.en: Don't be silly.
You were brought down every evening.
No.
I was brought down every tea time.
Or after tea, if Mama had guests, but I don't remember your being there often.
translation.de: Oder später, wenn Mama Gäste hatte. Aber du warst selten da.

translation.en: I was here.
You came and saw me sometimes when I was already in bed.
translation.de: Du sahst manchmal nach mir, wenn ich schlief.

translation.en: But not much.
All over this country...
all over the world,
there are children with no food and no shelter.
translation.de: leben Kinder ohne Essen und Obdach.

translation.en: You really cannot expect me to feel much sympathy
translation.de: Du kannst nicht erwarten, dass ich Mitleid habe,

translation.en: for the childhood that you enjoyed.
translation.de: bei der Kindheit, die du genossen hast.

translation.en: So, there's nothing you would have done differently?
translation.de: Du hättest also nichts anders gemacht?

translation.en: Don't over-complicate it.
Your role is to provide.
To be the man of the house.
translation.de: Du bist der Mann im Haus.

translation.en: [Alma] Don't tell me you've quarreled again.
We were discussing fatherhood... as it happens.
translation.de: Wir sprachen über die Vaterrolle... um ehrlich zu sein.

translation.en: Oh, you surprise me. [chuckles]
You wouldn't be surprised if you heard what he said.
translation.de: Wärst du nicht, wenn du ihn gehört hättest.

translation.en: And you'll be happy to hear
that I want to know my children better than he did.
translation.de: dass ich meine Kinder besser kennen will als er.

translation.en: I am happy.
[Alma] I'm so looking forward to becoming a mother.
translation.de: Ich freue mich so darauf, Mutter zu werden.

translation.en: -They've cut wages by five percent. -[woman 1] What?
-And what's next, ten? Fifteen? -[woman 1] How will I feed my family?
translation.de: Was kommt als Nächstes? Zehn? Wie soll ich davon meine Familie ernähren?

translation.en: -I know. -[woman 2] What?
translation.de: Wie soll ich davon meine Familie ernähren?

translation.en: -It's a wage cut, five percent. -[woman] They can't do that.
-The mill will reopen tomorrow. -[crowd clamors]
Go and spend the day with your families.
translation.de: Verbringt den Tag mit euren Familien.

translation.en: -What? Why? -[worker] You've already cut our wages.
translation.de: Was? Warum? -Trotz der Lohnkürzung? -Egal warum. Ich regle das.

translation.en: [Walsh] It don't matter why. I'll get it sorted.
translation.de: -Trotz der Lohnkürzung? -Egal warum. Ich regle das.

translation.en: What about pay? We gonna get paid for today?
I can't pay you for days when the mill isn't working.
translation.de: Ich kann euch nicht für freie Tage bezahlen.

translation.en: -[clamoring] -[Walsh] I'm sorry.
It'll all get straightened out by tomorrow.
translation.de: Bis morgen wird alles geklärt sein.

translation.en: Please, go home.
All members of Darwen Football Club, follow me.
The bank called in a loan.
translation.de: Die Bank forderte ein Darlehen zurück.

translation.en: When I couldn't pay up immediately, they foreclosed on the mill.
translation.de: Da ich nicht zahlen konnte, pfändeten sie die Fabrik.

translation.en: Now, I can get the mill reopened tomorrow, but it'll take all the liquidity.
translation.de: Ich kann morgen wieder öffnen, aber nur mit Geld.

translation.en: What's this got to do with us?
translation.de: Was hat das mit uns zu tun?

translation.en: The train tickets to take the team back down to London,
I need that money.
I need it to get the mill reopened and get the men back to work.
translation.de: Um die Fabrik zu öffnen. Damit die Männer wieder arbeiten können.

translation.en: We're gonna have to forfeit the match.
How much did you waste getting this pair in? [man] What?
[Tommy] He's paying 'em to play.
-He paid 'em to leave Partick. -Wait a minute.
-I saw the money you gave Jimmy. -[Walsh] That's none of your business.
translation.de: Du hast Jimmy Geld zugesteckt. Halt dich da raus.

translation.en: Now we're out of the Cup 'cause you've given away our fares. You can have it back.
translation.de: -Und wir scheiden aus. -Du kannst das Geld haben.

translation.en: -Barely a quarter of what's needed. -Maybe not.
But whilst our wages were being cut, you were paying them to play football.
translation.de: Aber uns kürzen Sie den Lohn und die bekommen Geld fürs Spielen.

translation.en: And what would've happened if we were found out?
We'd be banned from the Cup for God knows how many years!
translation.de: Man würde uns für Jahre ausschließen!

translation.en: -[Walsh] Enough. -You cheated.
And you made the rest of us cheat without even knowing it.
translation.de: Und wir auch, ohne unser Wissen.

translation.en: I said that's enough!
So it's over?
I'm very sorry.
Come on.
We don't know that Mr. Walsh won't find the money somewhere.
translation.de: Vielleicht treibt Mr. Walsh das Geld ja auf.

translation.en: We've given him all day.
As it is, we'll be sleeping on the train.
translation.de: Wir schlafen heute Nacht im Zug.

translation.en: But I--
I thought the OEs would beat us, and we would be sent home then, all right?
translation.de: Ich dachte, wir würden verlieren und nach Hause geschickt, ok?

translation.en: With our tail between our legs.
Don't pretend that you don't care about this place.
translation.de: Tu nicht so, als wäre dir das egal.

translation.en: I seen it last night when you realized how much this meant to these people.
translation.de: Du hast gesehen, wie viel es den Leuten bedeutet.

translation.en: You care about them too. No.
I care about the money.
But we can't give up now! It's the FA Cup!
translation.de: -Aber es ist doch der FA Cup! -Es ist vorbei.

translation.en: It is finished, Jimmy.
translation.de: -Aber es ist doch der FA Cup! -Es ist vorbei. Jimmy, die Fabrik ist dicht. Wir bleiben nicht hier.

translation.en: The mill's closed. We're not going south.
translation.de: Jimmy, die Fabrik ist dicht. Wir bleiben nicht hier.

translation.en: And I can play football for nothing back home with my family.
translation.de: Für umsonst kann ich auch zu Hause spielen.

translation.en: Pack your things.
Stay.
I can't.
But you can.
I can't.
Fergie and I...
We've always been together.
He needs me. Stay till tomorrow at least.
You don't want to travel at night.
Are you coming or not? Give me a minute.
I swear to God.
You need rid of that hat before we get back.
Folk'll have you down as a bloody Sassenach.
translation.de: Sonst hält man dich für einen Engländer.

translation.en: I don't care what they have me down as.
translation.de: Mir egal, wofür man mich hält.

translation.en: -[panting] You've got to come quickly. -What is it?
You'll see. Come on.
Come with me, both of you.
This is our train.
We're going home.
[Fergus] I don't understand. [Doris] Word got out Darwen would be forfeiting.
translation.de: -Was ist da los? -Sie haben erfahren, dass ihr aufgebt.

translation.en: The town won't have it. Tom Hindle came up with the idea.
translation.de: Sie wollten es nicht hinnehmen. Tom Hindle hatte eine Idee.

translation.en: We're selling subscriptions.
They can either pay weekly or all at once.
translation.de: Sie können entweder wöchentlich oder auf einmal zahlen.

translation.en: The point is,
we're going to the rematch.
-Don't those people need that money? -Maybe, but they need football too.
translation.de: -Brauchen die Leute das Geld nicht? -Vielleicht. Aber den Fußball auch.

translation.en: -[woman] We're proud of you, lads. -[man] You're what Darwen's made of.
translation.de: -Wir sind stolz auf euch. -Ihr seid echte Darwener.

translation.en: [woman] Here you go.
You're short three players. The match is due to start in ten minutes.
translation.de: Ihnen fehlen drei Spieler. Das Spiel beginnt in zehn Minuten.

translation.en: Well, I'm sure they won't be much longer.
You can use the dressing room if you'd like to be more comfortable.
translation.de: Sie können gerne in der Umkleide warten.

translation.en: We'll be on the pitch.
If you don't have a team on time, you forfeit.
translation.de: Wenn Sie kein Team haben, verlieren Sie.

translation.en: [Walsh] Or you play with what you've got.
translation.de: Oder Sie spielen mit dem, was Sie haben.

translation.en: You can't expect us to play when there's only eight of us.
To quote you, Mr. Kinnaird,
"Rules are made to be adhered to."
That is unless they happen not to suit you, of course.
translation.de: Außer natürlich, sie kommen Ihnen nicht gelegen.

translation.en: Ten minutes...
or we claim the win.
To whom will you claim the win?
To the FA committee?
The press.
Then everyone will see what good sports you gentlemen are.
translation.de: Dann werden alle sehen, welch gute Sportsmänner Sie sind.

translation.en: [scoffs] Who does he think he is?
If we don't have a full team, we ought to forfeit the game.
translation.de: Wenn wir kein Team haben, geben wir auf.

translation.en: What?
Why?
You heard him.
We're supposed to be gentlemen.
Two more minutes and the match is ours.
translation.de: Noch zwei Minuten und der Sieg ist unser.

translation.en: They're here. All of them.
Whatever he's paying you,
make sure you earn it.
We had them beat before.
We can do it again.
Where the hell have you been? You almost cost us the match.
translation.de: Wo wart ihr? Wir hätten fast verloren.

translation.en: Now, come here.
Now, we'll win this game, if we stop them playing their way.
translation.de: Wir gewinnen das Spiel, wenn wir sie an ihrem Spiel hindern.

translation.en: Alfred, stay on Love. Don't give him any time on the ball.
translation.de: Alfred, bleib bei Love. Lass ihm keine Zeit am Ball.

translation.en: -What about Suter? He's the real problem. -[Arthur] I'll stay on Suter.
translation.de: -Und Suter? Er ist das wahre Problem. -Ich bleibe bei Suter.

translation.en: You leave him to me.
-All right? -[Lyttelton] All right.
-[referee] Time. -[Lyttelton] All right, gents.
[referee] Gentlemen.
[Fergus] Jimmy!
[Fergus] Cross it, Jimmy!
[Alma] Did you see what Alfred did?
It didn't seem quite right.
Maybe not, but I'm afraid there'll be a great deal more of it.
translation.de: Tja, ich fürchte, das war noch nicht alles.

translation.en: [Walsh] Foul! Referee!
-Forward! -[Arthur] As a pack!
-Get off me! -[grunts]
[Walsh] Come on, Suter!
[Fergus] Together! Together!
I thought you youngsters were meant to be quicker than us older folk.
translation.de: Ich dachte, Sie wären schneller als wir alten Herren.

translation.en: Hurry up! At the ball! Heads up! Heads up!
[referee] Full-time. Full-time.
translation.de: Das war's, das Spiel ist zu Ende.

translation.en: That was a good game.
Did you even play?
Or did you just shadow me to stop me playing?
There's no need to be a bad loser.
Kinnaird can have his Cup.
Next season, it'll be ours.
If you'll stay.
Do you want me to?
Tommy Marshall thinks I'm a waste of money.
Well, he's wrong.
You're the only chance we've got of taking the Cup.
translation.de: Du bist unsere einzige Chance auf den Titel.

translation.en: Besides, people here, they love to watch you play.
translation.de: Außerdem sehen die Leute dir gerne zu.

translation.en: It gives 'em hope and pride and so much more.
translation.de: Es gibt ihnen Hoffnung. Und... Stolz und noch viel mehr.

translation.en: You're valued here, Suter.
Come on, lads.
Let's go home.
Admit it, they won!
Can I just say, well done us.
translation.de: Auf uns. Das haben wir gut gemacht.

translation.en: Hear, hear!
Speech!
-Come on, Arthur, speech! -[man] Speech!
Come on.
I won't pretend I'm not jolly pleased the way things have turned out.
translation.de: Ich will nicht so tun, als wäre ich nicht überaus erfreut.

translation.en: [Arthur] To have beaten Darwen,
and to be once again in the semi-finals...
translation.de: und einmal mehr im Halbfinale zu stehen...

translation.en: Excuse me.
I'm so sorry, I... I must leave you for a moment.
translation.de: Tut mir leid, ihr müsst mich kurz entschuldigen.

translation.en: -Shall I-- -[Alma] No, no, no. Please, sit.
Enjoy the rest of dinner.
And-- And well done.
All of you.
Very well done.
Excuse me.
Please.
Have they gone?
They have, at last. [chuckles]
Ada had to put Monkey in a fireman's lock before she could get him out.
How are you feeling? Hmm?
You any better?
[sighs] No, not much better, to be honest.
No... No...
No! [whimpers]
-[Arthur] Can anybody hear me?! -No!
Somebody send for a doctor!
[Walsh] Now, we might've lost...
but the town's still proud of you.
Here's the man of the hour, Fergus Suter!
translation.de: Hier ist der Mann der Stunde, Fergus Suter!
